channel.title: Hamachi VS Port Forward and No-Ip
channel.description:
Okay, so on the moparscape server status page, if you click hamachi, it says this:
[i]Hosting a server using hamachi is less than desirable. There is no way to check if they are online. They are less stable, have more lag, and are a potential security risk to your entire computer. If you decide to join a hamachi server make sure you have a good firewall enabled and do not accept any files from anyone you do not trust with access to your computer.[/i]
But lots of people on here are saying Hamachi removes lag. Also what risks do both methods of running your server have?
I know how to port-forward, i just can't (dad wont lemme). I'm considering using hamachi, but i don't want to after reading the message on the status page. Should i try convince my dad to lemme port-forward? Are there risks after port-forwarding? What happens when you port-forward. What is a port? Lol, IM A TOTAL NEWB. :o :o
I really want to host a server, i've been editing the Allstar-Scapev2 Source for awhile, and it's ready to go online.
P.S i am a retarded 13 yr old. dont be too harsh saying "OMFG UR A FUCKING NEWB ZOMG< LOZER>".

item.title: Hamachi VS Port Forward and No-Ip
item.dc:creator: @hasumon hasumon
item.description:
@hasumon wrote:

Think of it like this. You have a firewall on your modem/router… You portfoward to allow a small piece of that firewall to break down to allow people in that port. If you have too many ‘parts’ opened, you will be easier to be hacked/infected with viruses as it allows more connections in ^.^

Read full topic
item.source: Hamachi VS Port Forward and No-Ip

@dadancinman wrote:

-.- i still dont have any answers.

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi VS Port Forward and No-Ip
item.dc:creator: @Moo_Dragon Moo Dragon
item.description:
@Moo_Dragon wrote:

[quote=“xXx gl0wi xXx, post:2, topic:219245”]Well portforwarding is opening a port .
if the port is open . just like a door
if the door is open people can come in your server (house)
people are enable to come in your router and may hack your system
but i had a server for long time and it never happen.[/quote]
So…
The door is on the house…
And they can walk in the router?? :s?

Read full topic
